lexUnit.name: bend.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to be in a position in which one's body is folded, usually at the waist or the knees

sentence.text: She bolted into a deep brake of ferns and , bending low , crept away and then sank down and crouched motionless , hoping the two men would n't find her .
He bent low to study the packet .
She was bending forward towards Agnes now .
He bent forward to take the bouquet , and she felt something inside her tighten and twist as she shrank further behind her flowers .
Waking in the night to find her bending over him .
Count Trepolov was bending lovingly over a hive when Rose and Auguste arrived , fingers hovering , trying not to yield to the temptation to open the hive yet again .
But he only bent deeper over the picture .
And I can tell you something " -- he bent towards her -- ` their husbands have been warned to gag them , or else .
His arms came around her and she pressed willingly into them , lifting her chin and stretching up on her toes so that he did not have to bend so far towards her .
She rubbed her back at the same time ; bending to the floor had hurt her .
A man in the long robe of a clerk or scribe bent over the injured baron .
Abel suddenly bent down to the letterbox and called through , ` Grandfather Gebler , it s me -- Abel .
He slid his arm round her narrow waist and bent to kiss her on the forehead .
He bent slightly to examine her face .
